TopicTitle: So I was just watching NASA TV and saw KSP...

Articles.Content: I woke up from an afternoon nap and had NASA TV just now.They had on a serious clip/film talking about the rocket designs of the future, showing actual rocket parts in the manufacturing processes and etc. then all of a sudden it included five second clip of this particularly interesting looking "futuristic rocket" zipping out of the atmosphere. I rewinded it and took a picture. Yes, it is what you think it is and yes, they actually used it for an official NASA video:
I have built the future and know that it explodes.

Whaaaaaaaaaaaat?

That's insane! I hope they air the same episode again so I get to see them do that.
Nice find.
I saw that too!
Awesome!
First the spacex music and now this? Wow.

Lol, that's awesome. Nice to see that even Nasa is using KAD (Kerbal Aided Design) , even if it is just for demo videos

The next project for Squad will be AutoKAD
Jaw dropped, turned to my friend and said "TOLD YOU! KSP does teach rocket science!!!!!"

Is that-

It can't be-

Surely it isn't-

Kerbal Space Program, now officially shown to the entire space-geek community by NASA. Sure, it was for 5 seconds, and they didn't mention it by name, but still! With this and the whole Elon Musk thing, SQUAD must be practically dancing in joy right now.
